en: The Chester Inn at Jonesborough, Tennessee

This postcard is titled, "The Chester Inn at Jonesborough, Tennessee". The Chester Inn was built in 1797 by Dr. William P. Chester, a native of York County, Pennsylvania, who became a prominent physician in Jonesborough, Tennessee.  The Chester Inn is the oldest commercial building in Jonesborough. At the time this picture was taken the building was known as the Jonesboro Inn.  It is now a state historic site.
Era 8 - The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945)
